questions.question_text:
The implementations group has been using the test bed to do a "˜proof-of-concept' that requires both Client 1 and Client 2 to access the WEB Server at
209.65.200.241. After several changes to the network addressing, routing scheme, DHCP services, NTP services, and FHRP services, a trouble ticket has been opened indicating that Client 1 cannot ping the 209.65.200.241 address.
Use the supported commands to isolated the cause of this fault and answer the following questions.
What is the solution to the fault condition?
questions.answer_description: We need to allow VLANs 10 and 200 on the trunks to restore full connectivity. This can be accomplished by issuing the "switchport trunk allowed vlan 10,200" command on the port channels used as trunks in DSW1.

choices.B: In Configuration mode, using the interface port-channel 13, port-channel 23, then configure switchport trunk none allowed vlan none followed by switchport trunk allowed vlan 10,200 commands.
choices.D: In Configuration mode, using the interface port-channel 23, port-channel, then configure switchport trunk allowed vlan none followed by switchport trunk allowed vlan 10,20,200 commands.
choices.A: In Configuration mode, using the interface port-channel 13 command, then configure switchport trunk allowed vlan none followed by switchport trunk allowed vlan 20,200 commands.
choices.C: In Configuration mode, using the interface port-channel 23 command, then configure switchport trunk allowed vlan none followed by switchport trunk allowed vlan 20,200 commands.

questions.question_text:
The implementations group has been using the test bed to do a "˜proof-of-concept' that requires both Client 1 and Client 2 to access the WEB Server at
209.65.200.241. After several changes to the network addressing, routing scheme, DHCP services, NTP services, layer 2 connectivity, FHRP services, and device security, a trouble ticket has been opened indicating that Client 1 cannot ping the 209.65.200.241 address.
Use the supported commands to isolated the cause of this fault and answer the following questions.
The fault condition is related to which technology?
questions.answer_description: On DSW1, VALN ACL, Need to delete the VLAN access-map test1 whose action is to drop access-list 10; specifically 10.2.1.3

choices.D: Under the global configuration mode enter no vlan filter test1 vlan-list 10 command.
choices.C: Under the global configuration mode enter no vlan access-map test1 10 command.
choices.A: Under the global configuration mode enter no access-list 10 command.
choices.B: Under the global configuration mode enter no access-map vlan 10 command.

comments.content:
I disagree, correct answer is C.
We're only meant to be fixing the one client's ping issue, in which case we only need to remove entry 10 from the test1 route map which is used in the vlan filter.
The rest of the route map doesn't block that client from reaching the server.

discussion.content:
This is a typical Cisco exam question, far too open to interpretation but I have to agree with James - correct answer is C. The question clearly states "a trouble ticket has been opened indicating that Client 1 cannot ping the 209.65.200.241 address" - it doesn't mention Client 2 at all. IMO we shouldn't assume Client 2 has to be fixed even though the question's scenario/description suggests it would be affected by the same issue as Client 1. 

Of course that's only an opinion. Anyone out there get this question in the exam and get a 100% pass? If so, what was their answer?

"The implementations group has been using the test bed to do a "˜proof-of-concept' that requires both Client 1 and Client 2 to access the WEB Server at
209.65.200.241" 
Therefore, we should consider client 2 should be able to access to WEB Server. 
The correct answer is D.

questions.answer_description: On DSW1, VALN ACL, Need to delete the VLAN access-map test1 whose action is to drop access-list 10; specifically 10.2.1.3
